The entire point of the rule is so that knowledge if the game and Nemesis Q doesn't get out. But the old lady in question already knew the existance of Nemesis Q and  there are various urban legends and rumors about Psyren floating all over Japan. I'm begining to think the creator of this game is either an idiot or an asshole.

Not the universe but the earth.
[spoiler]People are sent to the future and have to get to a specified goal point before they come back to the present. The future in question is so dystopian that it makes the Fallout world look like The Garden of Eden.[/spoiler]

topics.body:
So I've decided to try my hand at National Novel Writing month. I got started today on something I'm probably going to discard, but there was stuff in there I want to expand on.

Basically I'm gonna try to go for a sort of gothic, urban fantasy noir story. It follows the work of a detective working in a world were vampires, werewolves, ghouls, frankensteins, ghosts, demons and all sorts of other monsters not only exist but are tax paying members of society.

Society is not happy about this. There is bigotry from some humans and some monsters, with the humans going "these are satanic beasts that want to eat us!" and the monsters going "wait, why aren't we eating them?"
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7
